alert.note: Alert for South Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 04 at 1:49PM PST until March 05 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, with up to 2 feet over higher terrain and for areas south of Mount Shasta. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County and South Central Siskiyou County, including Happy Camp, Callahan, Etna, Fort Jones, Greenview, Mount Shasta City, Dunsmuir, McCloud, and Interstate 5 and Highways 89, 96, and 3. * WHEN...Through 4 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: South Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County
